panels.title: L1 Batch height for base layer circuits
L1 Batch height for recursive layer circuits
L1 Batch height not sent to prover

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster, prover_group_id)
    (label_replace(
        label_replace(
            sum by(cluster, phase, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{pod=~"prover-gpu-fri-spec.*", phase="Pending"}),
            "cluster", "$1", "cluster", ".*?-(.*)"
        ),
    "prover_group_id", "$1", "pod", "^prover-gpu-fri-spec-([0-9]+)(-[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)?$")) > 0

panels.title: Pending prover per group per cluster

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster, prover_group_id)
    (label_replace(
        label_replace(
            sum by(cluster, phase, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{pod=~"prover-gpu-fri-spec.*", phase="Running"}),
            "cluster", "$1", "cluster", ".*?-(.*)"
        ),
    "prover_group_id", "$1", "pod", "^prover-gpu-fri-spec-([0-9]+)(-[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)?$")) > 0

panels.title: Running prover per group per cluster

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster)
    (label_replace(
        label_replace(
            sum by(cluster, phase, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{pod=~"prover-gpu-fri-spec.*", phase="Running"}),
            "cluster", "$1", "cluster", ".*?-(.*)"
        ),
    "prover_group_id", "$1", "pod", "^prover-gpu-fri-spec-([0-9]+)(-[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)?$")) > 0

sum by (prover_group_id)
    (label_replace(
        label_replace(
            sum by(phase, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{pod=~"prover-gpu-fri-spec.*", phase="Running"}),
            "cluster", "$1", "cluster", ".*()?-(.*)"
        ),
    "prover_group_id", "$1", "pod", "^prover-gpu-fri-spec-([0-9]+)(-[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)?$")) > 0

panels.title: Running prover per group per type
Basic circuits: Queue Size by id
GPU utilization by group id and cluster

panels.description: Histogram - time that state keeper spends waiting for a transaction in mempool. When non-zero - that means that the mempool is empty. When zero - that state keeper is working at highest throughput. The value is capped at one second - if we need to wait more, we start over. That means that if there are no incoming transactions, the graph will show flat line at one second
panels.title: Witness Vector gens  - sending to prover attempts

panels.description: Histogram - time that state keeper spends waiting for a transaction in mempool. When non-zero - that means that the mempool is empty. When zero - that state keeper is working at highest throughput. The value is capped at one second - if we need to wait more, we start over. That means that if there are no incoming transactions, the graph will show flat line at one second
